# Mull - Sui Transaction Explainer

> Mull is a free, open-source web application that explains Sui blockchain transactions in plain, human-readable language.

## What is Mull?

Mull (Korean for "water" - matching Sui's water theme) is a transaction explainer for the Sui blockchain. It takes complex blockchain transaction data and converts it into easy-to-understand summaries that anyone can read.

## Key Features

- **Plain Language Explanations**: Converts technical transaction data into simple summaries
- **Visual Flow Diagrams**: Shows token and NFT movements graphically
- **Comprehensive Details**: Gas fees, object changes, balance impacts all in one place
- **Network Support**: Works with both Sui Mainnet and Testnet
- **30+ Transaction Types**: Supports transfers, swaps, staking, NFTs, DeFi, bridges, and more

## Supported Transaction Types

### Basic Operations
- SUI and token transfers
- Coin merging and splitting
- Object creation and deletion

### DeFi
- Token swaps (Cetus, Turbos, DeepBook, etc.)
- Liquidity provision and removal
- Staking and unstaking
- Lending operations (borrow, supply, repay, withdraw)
- Liquidations

### NFTs
- NFT transfers
- NFT minting and burning
- Marketplace operations (listing, purchasing, offers)
- Kiosk operations

### Advanced
- Smart contract deployments
- Package upgrades
- Bridge transactions (Wormhole, etc.)
- SuiNS domain registrations
- Governance voting
- Multisig operations

## How to Use

1. Visit https://mull.vercel.app
2. Paste a Sui transaction digest (hash) in the search box
3. Select your network (Mainnet or Testnet)
4. Click "Explain" to see the transaction breakdown

## Technical Details

- Built with Next.js 16 and React 19
- Uses @mysten/sui SDK for blockchain interaction
- Open source under MIT License
- GitHub: https://github.com/leopard627/mull

## Creator

Built by JihunWeb3 (@JihunWeb3 on X/Twitter) for the Sui Foundation RFP Program.

## Links

- Website: https://mull.vercel.app
